html:
Brandy has announced an intimate, career-spanning memoir that will be published by Hanover Square Press on October 7, as People notes. The book, which does not yet have a title, will chronicle Brandy’s ascent from singing at her hometown church in McComb, Mississippi, to R&B stardom, acting, and beyond.

Brandy will discuss her achievements as a Grammy-winning performer, her acting roles— including the television series Moesha, Cinderella, and more—and struggles with difficult experiences such as bullying, body dysmorphia, mental health, competition, and more.

“I am so excited to finally share my full story in book form,” Brandy said in a press release. “This memoir is the result of countless hours of reflection, work and healing. I hope readers will find comfort and inspiration in these pages.”
